May
Eighteenth,
1 9 2 7
!
Mr. Iloyd H. Berendsen,
1517 Lake St.,
San Francisco.
Dear Sir:
In line with its policy to obtain data to enable it to
secure the best possible location for a municipal air port,
and. County
of San Francisco would like to locate on Varney
1ield, as per the enclosed map, a temporary
purpose of
securing meteorological
data.
structure for the
The work will be in
charge of men assigned from the United States Weather Bureau and
period
of observation will be from July 1, 1927, to June 30,
1928.
our desire to commence
the construction
necessary building and installation of the necessary instruments
immediately.
We would appreciate very much permission from the owners
and lessees
the Varney field
to locate the meteorological
station on this field, as per the map enclosed, with the privilege
of access to
course, it would be understood that in
the event that the owners sold the property before
June 30, 1928,
that the privilege would cease, and that upon a thirty day notice
from the owners
that we would remove the structure.
We also
desire the privilege of removing
the structure and instruments at
the expiration of the observation period.
I am enclosing a letter for the owners and lessees to
sign.
Thanking you in advance for any courtesies you may extend
to us, I
am
Very truly yours,
RIGHT OF WAY AGENT.
JJP :KH
